item.title: American x Italian Pub Crawl
item.description: Event cancelled Many of our members (and members of the Italian community more generally) are going through a difficult time and we have decided to cancel this event.

item.title: Andrea Agnelli
item.description: After taking his team to dominate the Italian Serie A for almost a decade and completing the most epic summer signing in history, the man who bought CR7 for Juve needs only a Champions League to cement his legacy.

item.title: Andrea Garnero
item.description: Link to live event: Facebook Announcing our next guest: OECD Economist Andrea Garnero.

item.title: Andrew Howe
item.description: We are extremely pleased to announce our last guest for this term: Mr.

item.title: Apericena "Come una volta"
item.description: Join us at this exciting aperitivo event at Wadham College! Italian food prepared by our brilliant committee will be served, together with alcoholic (Aperol spritz) and non-acoholic drinks.

item.title: Aperitivo Social
item.description: Aperitivo Social Night will be the first event of HT22, with delicious nibbles by ItaliAmo and Aperol Spritz.

item.title: Bebe Vio
item.description: Link to live event: Facebook We are excited to announce our next guest: Italian wheelchair fencer Beatrice (Bebe) Vio.

item.title: Carlo Cottarelli
item.description: Our friends at Nuffield College are hosting former IMF Director, Prime Minister Designate, Economist, Professor Carlo Cottarelli.

item.title: Carlo Verdone
item.description: OUIS is proud to welcome M.o Carlo Verdone, who will present his 2006 film Il mio Miglior Nemico.

item.title: Cheese Tasting
item.description: Join us for our first cheese tasting! Hosted with the Oxford Culinary Society, we are offering you an evening tasting 5 delicious cheeses picked out with the Jericho Cheese Company!

item.title: Chiara Albanese
item.description: We’re excited to announce our next guest: Chiara Albanese. Chiara is Italy’s government correspondent for Bloomberg News.

item.title: Christmas Pizza Night
item.description: As our last event of term we organised a Pizza Night at BBuona!

item.title: Cinema night
item.description: Perfetti sconosciuti Perfetti Sconosciuti (English: Perfect Strangers) is a 2016 Italian comedy-drama film directed by Paolo Genovese.

item.title: Cinema night
item.description: The Great Beauty “La grande bellezza” (English: “The great beauty”) is a 2013 Italian art drama film co-written and directed by Paolo Sorrentino.

item.title: Dr Bianca Garavelli
item.description: In occasion of the seventh centennial of Dante Alighieri’s death, we will be interviewing Dr Bianca Garavelli, acclaimed author and literary critic, especially known for her work on Dante.

item.title: Dr Gaya Spolverato
item.description: Join us for our interview with Dr Gaya Spolverato, surgical oncologist and an Assistant Professor at the University of Padua (Padua, Italy), co-founder and President of “Women in Surgery Italia”.

item.title: Elsa Fornero
item.description: OUIS is delighted to be welcoming former Minister, Professor Elsa Fornero.

item.title: Emma Bonino
item.description: Presentiamo con grade entusiasmo la nostra prossima ospite, l’Onorevole Emma Bonino, Senatrice della Repubblica, ed Ex Ministro.

item.title: End of Term Aperitivo
item.description: Whether it’s relaxing at the end of term, taking a break from revision or simply seeking good food and aperol, there is no better place to be at the start of the last week!

item.title: Enrico Letta
item.description: We are proud to announce that Former Prime Minister Enrico Letta will be joining the Oxford University Italian Society on a Facebook live web stream event on April 20th at 3pm (UK time).

item.title: European Night
item.description: Get ready for a night of cultural exchange and buzz! 🤩🥳 The collaboration of European societies you have all been waiting for has finally arrived.

item.title: Fabio Bianco
item.description: We’re excited to announce our next guest: Fabio Bianco, entrepreneur and Chief Scientific Officer at Bio4Dreams

item.title: Film Night
item.description: Indagine su un cittadino al di sopra di ogni sospetto

item.title: Film Night
item.description: I Soliti Ignoti We will end the term with an italian classic from 1958 by Mario Monicelli featuring Vittorio Gassman, Totò, Claudia Cardinale, Marcello Mastroianni…

item.title: Film Night
item.description: Il Sorpasso For this term’s movie nights, we’re partnering up with Films For Europe-Oxford, to guide you through some of the most important Italian contributions to postwar cinema.

item.title: Film Night
item.description: 8 1/2 For this term’s movie nights, we’re partnering up with Films For Europe-Oxford, to guide you through some of the most important Italian contributions to postwar cinema.

item.title: Film Night
item.description: Il Conformista For this term’s movie nights, we’re partnering up with Films For Europe-Oxford, to guide you through some of the most important Italian contributions to postwar cinema.

item.title: Film Night
item.description: Amici Miei Another classic from Italian cinematography acted out by the superb Ugo Tognazzi!

item.title: Film Night
item.description: I Cento Passi Join us for the screening of a great Italian film released in 2000, directed by Marco Tullio Giordana about the life of Peppino Impastato, a political activist who opposed the Mafia in Sicily.

item.title: Film Night + Aperol Spritz
item.description: Il Divo A 2008 Italian biographical drama film based on the figure of former Italian Prime Minister Giulio Andreotti.

item.title: Final aperitivo and buffet (+elections)
item.description: Don’t miss our final event of the term! We will have copious amounts of Italian food and wine including a number of different “pasta fredda” bowls as well as lots of nibbles and starters including fresh Sicilian cannoli.

item.title: Football night + Aperol
item.description: We will be displaying the Italy vs Switzeralnd match, which is worth the qualification to the world cup for the Italian team!

item.title: Gianluca Di Marzio
item.description: Gianluca di Marzio is one of the most world-renowned sport journalists and is best known for being a leading football transfer expert.

item.title: Gianni Pittella
item.description: Questo evento nasce da una collaborazione tra la Cambridge University Italian Society e la Oxford University Italian Society Insieme al Senatore Gianni Pittella, già Vicepresidente del Parlamento Europeo, cercheremo di capire la natura delle istituzioni europee con uno sguardo rivolto al futuro: quali sono le condizioni affinché nascano gli Stati Uniti d’Europa?

item.title: Giulio Tremonti
item.description: Link to live event: Facebook It is a pleasure to announce a partnership with ASP, the society of Political Science at LUISS Guido Carli University of Rome.

item.title: Giuseppe Civati
item.description: We are extremely pleased to announce our next guest: the Italian politician and activist Giuseppe Civati.

item.title: Half-Price Aperitivo
item.description: Welcome back! We start the term with our classic aperitivo. Given the HUGE success of last time, we have reduced capacity and slightly changed the format of our event.

item.title: Italian Academia - Challenges and Opportunities
item.description: Italian academia has undergone significant changes in the last ten years following the wholesale reform of the sector in 2010.

item.title: Italian Startups - TheInterna
item.description: TheInterna connects students completing their year abroad in Italy with internships in innovative small businesses.

item.title: Joint formal with OUGS
item.description: We are excited to continue one of our favourite traditions: The Trinity Term Exchange Dinner.

item.title: Know your Embassy!
item.description: We are excited to present to you all our next event, organised in conjunction with 10+ Italian societies and the Italian Embassy in London.

item.title: Luciana Littizzetto
item.description: Join us for our interview with acclaimed comedy actress and humour writer Luciana Littizzetto!

item.title: Lucrezia Reichlin
item.description: This public lecture is part of the series Expertise and politics: lessons from Italy.

item.title: MADE IT
item.description: We are extremely pleased to announce our first guests for Hillary term: Camilla Scassellati & Inès Makula, founders of Made IT, Italy’s #1 entrepreneurship podcast on Apple.

item.title: Marco Cappato
item.description: Link to live event: Facebook We are extremely pleased to announce our second guest of the term: Marco Cappato.

item.title: Marco Cartasegna
item.description: Introducing our next guest, founder of Torcha, Marco Cartasegna. After graduating with a degree in Economics and Management at Bocconi University in Milan, and completing a specialisation in Management and Digital Business in Madrid, Marco Cartasegna founded Torcha in the spring of 2020.

item.title: Marco Montemagno
item.description: Link to live event: Facebook We are extremely excited to announce a new guest of our online speaker series the term: Marco Montemagno.

item.title: Pizza night at BBuona!
item.description: Join us at our first in-person social since the pandemic began!

item.title: Pizza night at BBuona!
item.description: Join us at our first in-person social of the academic year!

item.description: We will have the pleasure of interviewing Professor Francesca Dominici from Havard T.

item.title: Prof. Marco Simoni
item.description: We’re excited to announce our next guest: Prof. Marco Simoni, President of the Human Technopole

item.title: Prof. Tomaso Montanari
item.description: Il nostro prossimo speaker studia l’arte dell’età barocca e la storia del patrimonio culturale.

item.title: Raffaele Trombetta
item.description: Not long after the 31 October Brexit deadline, HE the Italian Ambassador to the United Kingdom will be delivering a speech at Lincoln College.

item.description: We are happy to announce our next guest: Rossella Miccio, President of EMERGENCY NGO.

item.title: Simone Billi
item.description: We’re excited to announce our next guest: Simone Billi, Italian MP, Lega We will host a panel discussion with Simone Billi on Zoom (please fill in the Google form sent in the week 2 newsletter to take part).

item.title: Sonia Peronaci
item.description: We are delighted to announce our next guest: Sonia Peronaci, founder of Giallo Zafferano and top digital entrepreneur in Italy.

item.title: Tito Boeri
item.description: Event Cancelled

item.title: Unlimited Pizza @BBuona
item.description: We end the term with our classic aperitivo. Given the success of last time, we have partnered with BBuona to bring our members and guests some of the best ingredients from central Italy.

item.title: Vino & Victuals
item.description: OUIS is back after the summer break! Just like our normal aperitivo but a few hours later, come to the Sutro Room at Trinity for some Mediterranean nibbles and wine.

item.title: Welcome Aperitivo
item.description: OUIS is back! With so many exciting plans for TT2019 we’re starting with a classic!

item.title: Wine Tasting
item.description: Join us and our friends from the Wine Tasting Society as we embark on a journey.
